text:
My childhood was filled with joy, laughter, and plenty of adventure. I was an only child, but I was never lonely. My parents were always encouraging me to explore and discover the world around me. 

I remember the very first time my dad took me camping. We had packed up the car with all the tents and supplies and drove up to the mountains for the weekend. It was so exciting to be out in nature, away from the hustle and bustle of the city. I felt the fresh air and smelled the pine trees as I ran around the campsite, exploring and discovering new things. 

My dad taught me how to fish. I remember the way he patiently showed me how to cast the line and how to hold the rod. He taught me all the different kinds of fish that lived in the lake, and which kind of lure worked best. I was so proud when I finally caught one! 

On the weekends, my parents would take me on hikes. We would explore the trails and find hidden waterfalls and secret coves. I remember the way I felt, standing on the edge of a cliff, looking out at the vastness of the forest and feeling so small. My parents would tell me stories about the history of the area, and I would soak it all up. 

We also spent a lot of time playing games. I loved playing board games with my parents, and I was always trying to get them to play with me. They were always so patient and willing to teach me the rules, and we would laugh and play for hours. I was never bored when I was around my parents.

When I wasn’t playing with my parents, I was often reading. I was an avid reader and had a huge collection of books. I would lose myself in the stories and be transported to far away countries and magical lands. Reading helped me to develop my imagination and taught me so much. 

My childhood was filled with love, adventure and lots of fun. I was so lucky to have such wonderful parents who were always encouraging me to explore and learn. I’m so grateful for all the wonderful memories I have of my childhood.
prompt:

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.
